answers.answer: i would get an EMG/nerve conduction study to rule out a nerve compression in the back.if it is negative, start taking a multivitamin to re-establish the nutrients in the body which can help heal the nerves.  also, check to see if you are a diabetic by getting a HBA1C test to check your blood sugar levels.  diabetes can cause neuropathy can cause numbness in the feet.

question: After receiving IV (3 litres Sodium), my feet became swollen. The swelling has subsided but the soles of my feet (toes and a bit beyond-not heels) remain numb. is there anything I can do about this? I am able to walk but even a light jog is difficult.
title: Numb Soles
